text:
Days after allegations of rape and molestation by Jat quota agitators near Haryana’s Murthal, a woman came forward and filed the first case of gang rape on Sunday.

“An FIR has been lodged against seven persons on the basis of a complaint filed by a Narela-based woman on Sunday,” Haryana Police, DIG, Rajshree Singh told reporters.

She said the victim alleged she was raped on the intervening night of February 22-23 and the perpetrators included her brother-in-law. The complainant said she knew all of them.

The officer, who heads a three-member team of women police officers constituted by the Haryana government to go into alleged incidents of rape and molestation of several women by Jat protesters, however, said it was possible that a “family dispute” was the reason behind the woman filing the complaint. The officer said the victim was not sure of the exact scene of the crime but claimed she was raped in a building near Murthal when she was on her way to Narela in Delhi from Haridwar on a van.

The woman, however, said her 15-year-old daughter, who was accompanying her, was not raped. But her clothes were torn.

Statement recorded

The DIG said the woman had called her up on Saturday and her statement was recorded on Sunday.

Ms. Singh said most of the complaints she was receiving were from men who claimed their vehicles had been damaged. Earlier, some locals had claimed they had seen women being dragged to the fields by the protesters. TV channels showed footage of women’s garments strewn in some places. — PTI
title: First Murthal rape complaint lodged
